Player History
Drafted in 6th round, 108th overall pick, by Boston in 1965...
Injured on 6/22/1966 with a Strained Tricep Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Injured on 4/28/1967 with a Sore Elbow, out for one week...
Released by Boston on 5/5/1969...
Drafted in 6th round, 107th overall pick, by Baltimore in 1972...
Traded from Baltimore to Philadelphia on 2/6/1972 (Going to PHI: C T. Donohue. Going to BAL: P D. Hamilton)...
Injured on 4/29/1978 with a Strained Bicep Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Injured on 8/3/1979 with a Bruised Ribs, out for one week...
Injured on 4/30/1981 with a Dislocated Shoulder, out for 6-7 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1982, off Mike Krukow (ATL)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/23/1982, off Ray Jarvis (NYM)...
Won World Series with Philadelphia in 1984...
Drafted in 1st round, 14th overall pick, by San Francisco in 1987...
Injured on 4/26/1989 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Injured on 7/25/1989 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 6 days...
Injured on 8/18/1989 with a Strained Back, out for one week...
Injured on 7/25/1990 with a Pulled Bicep Tendon, out for 3 weeks...
Injured on 5/14/1991 with a Inflamed Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Injured on 7/7/1991 with a Pulled Tricep Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Earned first career win on 5/7/1992...
Injured on 7/21/1997 with a Bone Chips Elbow, out for 6 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/11/1998, winning 2 games with a 0.52 ERA...
Injured on 8/28/1998 with a Torn Tricep Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
